edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.bitstream
Class BitstreamHeader

java.lang.Object
  edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.bitstream.BitstreamHeader

public class BitstreamHeader
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains all of the information in a configuration bitstream header. The bitstream header is the extra information added at the top of a true bitstream and is used by Impact and other bitstream tools to figure out what is in the actual bitstream. A bitstream header contains the following information: - Name of the source NCD file - the part name - The date created - The time created - The length of the bitstream The length of the bitstream is not saved in this class. This is calculated based on the actual contents of the bitstream. TODO: update the toString method so that it prints the parsed fields of the header.

BitstreamHeader

public BitstreamHeader(java.lang.String sourceNCDFileName,
                       java.lang.String partName,
                       java.lang.String dateCreated,
                       java.lang.String timeCreated)
Create a new bitstream header using the parameters given to fill the header fields

Parameters:
sourceNCDFileName - The String name of the source NCD file
partName - The name of the part (currently this does not check to see if it is valid)
dateCreated - The date the bitstream was created
timeCreated - The time the bitstream was created

getDateCreated

public java.lang.String getDateCreated()
Returns the date the bitstream was created as a string year/month/day, for example: 2009/02/19.

Returns:
The date the bitstream was created as a string.

getHeaderBytes

public java.util.List<java.lang.Byte> getHeaderBytes(int length)
Returns the raw bytes for a bitstream header and includes the length of the bitstream in the header. The length is passed in as a parameter rather than using the class bitstreamLength member as this value may change when generating the bitstream. This method does NOT generate the sync word.

Parameters:
bitstreamLength -
Returns:

getHeaderBytesWithoutLength

public java.util.List<java.lang.Byte> getHeaderBytesWithoutLength()
This function will assemble the raw bytes of the header from the values contained within this object. This method will NOT add the length field of to the array (other methods are available for adding the length). This method will also NOT include the SYNC word. This method will also make sure that the header ends on a 4 byte boundary so the sync word starts on a 4 byte boundary.

public java.lang.String getPartName()
